prompts.en: Travel back nine months before you were born: which season (or month if you like precision) did the sperm of your father impregnate the egg of your mother? What do you associate with this season or month? What are the best and worst memories you have regarding that specific season/month, throughout your life?
prompts.es: Viaja nueve meses antes de nacer: ¿en qué estación (o mes si quieres ser preciso) el esperma de tu padre fecundó el óvulo de tu madre? ¿Qué asocias con esta estación o mes? ¿Cuáles son los mejores y peores recuerdos que tienes sobre esa estación/mes específico a lo largo de tu vida?

This prompt brings an interesting internal dilemma of mine to the surface. The prompt implies that we are "conceived" of by our parents, but the word 'conceive' also has a cognitive component.

9 months before I was born, 21 January of 1992. It was a hot summer day. My parents where probably with other friends at a gathering or simply enjoying the summer holidays somewhere in the world. I love the weather and freedom from this month. I associate southern hemisphere summer with being outside, the beach, lots of activities, friends gathered together. This energy, at the same time can bring down effects if not handled properly. For example, I remember as negative feelings of this season, the social anxiety of missing out or not being ready with a plan to enjoy. Always trying to be part of something and trying to be where the sun shines at its brightest (in a metaphorical way), this means looking for the hype or the cool things. Nevertheless, Summer has always given me nice stories to share, lots of growth and being outside of the comfort zone. I love enjoying the sun, beach, waves. In this season Ive met many new friends, got into problems which then became stories to share and the connection with water was always present.

The month that I was born was May, which would mean that my parents concaugust would be the month that I was conceived. The majority of my experiences during that month are rarely something that I would characterize as being good or something I enjoy. In fact, the only time/s I can think of recently enjoying that time of my life, was during the 2020/2021 timeframe where we were all at home working from home and the united states seemed to basically shut down. I was on hiatus from work due to anxiety issues and I spent 4-5 hours a day walking and cleaning up my neighborhood. When I wasn't doing that I was spending time with my family and developing on my skills to become a full stack developer. As well, I played Axie Infinity and met some people who ended up being a huge impact on my life. One of those people was a person who went by TormentX1, and they actually ended up passing away

It was November. En noviembre pasó. Y en noviembre se produjo este encuentro sagrado entre la esperma de mi papa y el huevo de mi mamá. Está empezando el verano. Está acercándose el calor. Lo que viene a mí es que no me importa mucho cual es la temporada del año. No me importa nada. Y empezamos con las críticas hacia mi mismo nuevamente, porque no me importa, porque no me acuerdo. Porque estoy perdido. Porque no se de mi. Porque no se por donde avanzar. Hacia donde avanzar. Porque lo único que hay son criticas. Pero por que no explorar?

El verano trae a mi un short. Salir al sol. Caminar por la calle. Abrazar la apertura del mundo. Desde la calle. Desde lo que hay afuera. Desde la visa que sucede afuera. Desde lo que aparece. Desde las golondrinas. Siento que mi conciencia se está derritiendo, y que no tengo memoria. Siento que no tengo memoria, y que no voy a ningún lado. Me siento perdido. Qué viene ahora? Cual es el siguiente paso? Me rindo? Será que llego el momento de rendirse? Será que no hay luz?! Será que no quiero ver esa luz? Será que eso que me hace sentir perdido es la

Cuando camino y me encuentro con algo que me emociona y causa amor y compasión lo tomo lo observo lo cuido lo respeto. pues la vida mis padres me han enseñado que las cosas que importan deben respetarse cuidarse, admirarse respetar los silenciosn del tro, la vida del otro, sobretodo los animales, cuidarlos y guardarlos asteorsarlos. con caricias, besos amor, masajes, abrazos muchos abrazos. Nada mas lindo que preparar una comida una rica merienda a quien amas.  No es posible que noo respetemos a los seres que amamso. y a los animales de este planeta. Quiero que no haya sufrimiento de esos seres inocentes. incluso siento mas empatia por ellos que por el propio ser humao. Me duelen mucho esas victimas de guerra que casi no salen en la TV, o que son victimas de incendios intencionales, se queman hectareas, casas, autos pero en cada copa de arbol en cada hoja hay un insecto, un pajaro un conejo, una ardilla, un gatito perdido. Deberiamos crecer rodeados de arboles, de animales y que eso nos enseñe a respetarlos. pues son ellos los que llegaron primero no nosotros. 
Cual es el mayor depredador, nosotros el ser humano!!!
Pues

las memorias que vienen desde ese mes de noviembre. 10 de noviembre. un día después del cumpleaños de mi mujer. ese es el momento en el que se encontraron. más o menos. noviembre trae a mi recuerdos de la época final del colegio. se está terminando el año, están empezando las vacaciones más largas del año. estamos avanzando hacia el encuentro del calor. aunque el calor ya ha empezado. estamos reconociéndonos en ese calorcito que se siente. estamos recibiendo ese calor. qué recuerdos tengo de ese tiempo? 

lo que viene es cuando se acaban las clases. me acuerdo jugando cartas mitos y leyendas, esperando que el tiempo pase. me acuerdo de que no me acuerdo. de que estoy solo. de que hay mucha soledad en mi, esa soledad existencial que me hace no tener claro si es que hay algo que está mal en mi, si hay algo que tengo que mejorar. si hay algo que tengo que procesar, y que no lo estoy haciendo bien. si hay algo que es necesario construir de una forma nueva. abrazando algo nuevo. recordando algo nuevo. inventando algo nuevo. me abrazo, con ternura. con cariño. me abrazo reconociendo en este momento un regalo. me abrazo con ese regalo. hay un vacío adentro, por esta sensación eterna de ser un fracaso. de no saber cómo abrazar ese fracaso. de no saber cómo procesarlo, entenderlo, manifestarlo. de no saber de dónde viene el fracaso. de esconderme detrás de ese fracaso. y abrazarlo. lo abrazo. te abrazo. gracias querido fracaso. acá estoy para hacerte frente. para encontrarme contigo.

para enfrentarte con todo. estoy acá. reconociendo todo lo que venga. estoy acá, para ser feliz. lo tengo todo. lo tengo todo. lo tengo todo.

Talvez era julio, por ahí diría yo. En Chile es invierno, así es que algo de frío haría. Después de nacer me mudé a Suecia y seguía haciendo frío. La cuestión es que viajamos mucho en mi infancia de hemisferio a hemisferio, así es que cuando estábamos en Europa hacia calor en esa época. La energía del verano es muy diferente a la del invierno. A mi me encanta el invierno, no lo había pensado hasta ahora, que talvez es porque fui concebida en invierno y nací llegando la primavera en abril. Me encanta el silencio del invierno, la lluvia, el quedarse en casa abrigadita junto ala estufa y en el mejor de los casos el fuego. No tengo problema con ninguna estación la verdad, creo que viajar tanto me hizo bien adaptable. El calor extremo no me fascina, eso sí. Pero veo el encanto en el otoño, con sus maravillosos colores, en la primavera, con su energía de renacimiento, en el invierno, con el rec

It would have been around December that my father impregnated my mother. He didn't want me - he told me so. I think back to a time when I was 12 years old in foster care. I was shovelling the snow outside after a huge snow- and school had been called off. During this time I felt particularly lonely. Not alone, there were always people around. It was also a time I really began to reflect deeply and realize how "alone" I was in the world. It felt heavy. Miserable. I was so incredibly sad, and had no one to turn to - except myself. I was always introspective, but these intense childhood experiences with so much trauma made me go inward even more. I wanted connection, to be seen, and to be loved. Only now am I beginning to truly see myself as I continue to unravel the layers of the ideas of myself. I'm honoured to be on this journey no matter how challenging and

Physical interactions that express unspoken aspects of my love and compassion are long hugs, tender kisses, running my fingers through my boyfriends hair. 

Not necessarily physical but more energetic are when see my boyfriend doing something that I admire and I direct my energy towards him with love, compassion and a yeah... you go.

Interaction in the bath with my boyfriend express love and compassion, I also consider the interaction when we dance and hang out together.

A tender hug with anyone is an expression of love.

Noviembre. me parece que es noviembre. me parece que en noviembre fue que se empezó a construir mi aparición en este mundo. mi bienvenida. el momento en el que comencé a participar de este juego llamado vida, comenzando ese mágico proceso de gestación adentro de mi madre. adentro de la guatita de mi mamá. con ese calor primordial. primitivo. básico. completo. con ese calor que da vida. con ese calor que encuentra. con ese calor que me encuentra y que es el calor que comienza a recorrer la tierra donde nací en este momento del año. es el momento del año en el que la primavera se comienza a transformar en verano. el calor empieza, y se siente.

se siente ese calor. no tengo recuerdos específicos de este momento del año, simplemente difusos. simplemente del comienzo del fin de las clases en el colegio. del cumpleaños de mi mujer, cerca del momento en el que se produjo esta gestación. cerca del momento en el que comenzó. cerca del momento en el que apareció. ella nació en noviembre, yo fui concebido en noviembre. quizás en el mismo día. quién sabe.

quizás eso es algo que nos une desde lo inconsciente. desde lo primitivo. desde lo básico. quizás desde ahí nos encontramos. nos amamos. desde esa conexión que existe más allá de lo que es concreto. real. manifiesto. lo que hay adentro, y lo que nos encuentra. lo que hay adentro y que se expresa en la conexión que tenemos. que se expresa en la manifestación de lo que hay adentro y que tenemos. que se recorre. que se encuentra. que se manifiesta, y que se hace sentir. que se siente y que se encuentra. que se siente y que se manifiesta. que se encuentra y que se hace sentir. que se hace reconocer. que se hace manifestar.

se encuentra y se manifiesta y aparece y desaparece. se encuentra y está acá. se encuentra y nos recorre, de adentro hacia afuera. nos encuentra. nos abraza. nos recorre. enteros. nos recorre enteros y nos da vida. nos abraza.

ese momento del año que nos abraza con su calor, y nos da vida. con su calor. con lo que hay acá.

con lo que se encuentra. ac

i touch a lot, my girlfriend, my son, friends, close peers and collaboratores. I like long storng hugs, in fact, I am highly regarded as a world-class hugger. I can express so much more with my hands than with my words. I absolutely adore and worship my goddess, and I give her all the attention by wobbling her ass, just randomly in the kitchen, and for hours when we have sexual play. I give more affection via my hands than I am able to do with my spoken words. Why is that? Perhaps because being non-verbal feels safer? My hands are so trained to invoke positive feelings on the skin on another person, whereas my spoken words have, in the past at least, often cause irritations, hurt, anger and other negative feelings in others. I also touch my teenage son a lot, like from behind, hugging him around his shoulders and chest, to give him the reassurance of his papa that he is ok and the it's all going to work out. I can embody this with utmost confidence, wheras in the spoken word, I guess, I sometimes have doubt in my voice, which then I notice and then I wonder if the other person notices this, and then I might feel a bit more nervous, and that becomes a vicious cycle. All in all, I am a very tactile person, even thou

Bueno, considero que soy reservado, mis interacciones físicas expresan frialdad , aunque sea lo contrario, no creo en el amor, aunque quisiera sentirlo, claro esta dependiendo a que tipo de amor se refiera uno, amistad, familia, hacia una mujer, por otra parte si que considero que  mediante mis interacciones, puedo mostrar compasión , aunque con mucha gente no debería, es todo muy complejo para poder expresarlo, así a la ligera, por lo cual creo que es todo lo contrario, que demuestra realmente otra cosa aunque sienta otra, a veces uno no elige como reacciona la otra persona, a tus interacciones dado que cada persona tiene una perspectiva sobre cada acción, cada persona crea su realidad, puedes hacer algo por su bien y esa persona pensar lo contrario. O al revés.

One True Three Four    I don't know which month it was but it is a question for cicadas to answer. all i know is that birches grew not far. Everything was blooming. whether in the nature or people's minds. if the month was january, then it was cold, but even though there was not enough good food, people found depth in their experience. sometimes i wish that time continued into the present, but maybe it exists in other people's days, not as much in my own. i wish there was more to say about the birches, but all they were doing was standing and listening to the wind howl quietly but coldly, freezingly. snow sometimes turned to a crispy ice on its top and reflected the brightest sun ever known to crows in this side of town. the houses were mostly heated with coal, and one could smell that smoke eerywhere through the city. i wonder if the streetcar track was there or if it was built later. probably it was, just laying there, dividing the city in square and triangle parts. i love winter. i love going into the banya and then running out into the snow, sometimes, i just wish i was there fully present, but i guess i needed to learn that lesson. hindsight is not a trait common to many. or maybe it is but everyone's hiding it, even from themselves. we kinda know what's going to happen. who are we? who am i
i will find out

Calculando nueve meses antes de mi nacimiento sería el mes de Mayo. Un mes que en lo personal da el inicio de la temporada de invierno , una etapa del año que está marcada por una disminución en la luz natural, el inicio de las lluvias y el mal clima. En lo personal es el mes que da inicio a la temporada del año que menos me gusta. Un periodo necesario durante el año que genera instancias de contemplación, tranquilidad y mayor descanso pero que me afecta anímicamente debido a la falta de luz y horas para disfrutas de mi días. 
Pensándolo más en profundidad es un mes que es el contrario a mis meses favoritos, más ligados a la fecha en la cual nací. Dándome cuenta a medida que lo escribo probablemente Mayo es el inicio de la temporada que menos disfruto del año, pero mirándolo desde otro punto de vista si me fascina la belleza de este mes, en donde tod

It would have been around December that my father impregnated my mother. He didn't want me - he told me so. I think back to a time when I was 12 years old in foster care. I was shovelling the snow outside after a huge snow- and school had been called off. During this time I felt particularly lonely. Not alone, there were always people around. It was also a time I really began to reflect deeply and realize how "alone" I was in the world. It felt heavy. Miserable. I was so incredibly sad, and had no one to turn to - except myself. I was always introspective, but these intense childhood experiences with so much trauma made me go inward even more. I wanted connection, to be seen, and to be loved. Only now am I beginning to truly see myself as I continue to unravel the layers of the ideas of myself. I'm honoured to be on this journey no matter how challenging and pain

Creo que sucedió durante la primavera. Mas alla de el romanticismo esteriotipado de la primavera, existe dentro de mi una extrana, y muy trascendental fijación con los brotes de los arboles que parecen muertos en invierno. Hay algo extraordinario con ese suceso. Lo más fragil del brote, es capaz de romper la corteza del arbol, y con una ternura infinita, asomar colores super especiales a la luz del dia. 
Esos colores también reflejan algo en mi vida. Son los colores que estoy usando en este momento en mi ropa. 
Es espectacular entender que existio un escenario antes de si quiera tener formados los ojos en tu craneo, estabas habitando la tierra, quien sabe en cuantas formas antes de encarnar en un cuerpo fisico denso. 
Estos escenarios nos ensenaron otros aspectos escenciales de la vida.   
La primavera tiene que haber ayudado a romantizar la union de mis padres.
Y ese sentimiento, se alguna formal fue transmitido. 
Tambien recuerdo el reverdecer de los andes, y sus flores miniaturas, cubriendo una pradera en la ladera sur.

En mi caso nueve meses antes de mi nacimiento cae el mes de mayo. Para mi un mes que marca el inicio al periodo del año que menos me gusta. Es un mes que lo asocio al cambio de luz, a la llegada del frío y sobre todo a las lluvias. Pensando en este mes principalmente no tengo recuerdos positivos asociados, es un mes que para mi en lo personal da el inicio al invierno en el lugar que vivo actualmente. Mayo es un mes de lluvias fuertes y tormentas, marca el inicio de meses oscuros y fríos, en los cuales tendré poca luz en mis dias durante una estación invernal. Pensándolo desde lo más adentro de mi ser probablemente es el mes que da inicio al periodo del año que menos me gusta pero que por otro lado es muy necesario. Un periodo de introspección, de tranquilidad, de acostarse temprano y de descansar, un período del año necesario

My mom was around 30 years old when I was born. She had a good support network form what i know. Her mom and two sisters were around to help out. They lived in a town about 45 min drive away. So not too much of an inconvience, all things considered. My dads family lived in another town about 2 hours away. There was not much support needed from either side. My immediate family has always been independent. My dad worked a lot when I was younger, starting before I was born. He did help to provide finincial support, housing, safety, all the provider things expected. My mom has told the story of getting to the hospital when I was born. Aprearantly my dad was working so my mom ended up having to drive herself to the hospital, while in labor. It all worked out in the end as there were no complications with the birth. She says my dad just had to show up and cut the cord, while she did all the work. That is a main trait I admire about my mom. Her fortitude and independance was well beyond her time. I think she will be a great example for my niece to follow

My mom moved to the US when she was 21 years old after my father had won the green card lottery in poland through a special program for those trying to escape communism in a post soviet era poland. When she arrived, she had very little material possesions, could hardly speak the language, and was largely disappointed that my father had swindled her into living situations that were not ideal. In poland, she came from well off family but after world war II the situation in poland was up in the air and many people were fleeing the country. She arrived in the US already pregnant with my brother and far away from anyone in her family. The circumstances were not ideal and she would sow in a textile factory to find the means to get by until she was physically unable to do so. She
superPrompt:
<instructions>

Write 5000 words about a day in Luna's life (the mother of Anky), using it for exemplifying her blend of community involvement and personal solitude. This day should reflect her typical experiences during late August or early September, embodying the transitional essence of the season and its impact on her character and outlook.

The narrative should capture Luna leading a community art project in the morning, engaging with local residents, and demonstrating her ability to foster collective creativity and connection. Highlight her interactions, the atmosphere of the communal setting, and how it resonates with her spirit. Use dialogue for this.

This scene should illustrate her leadership and her deep bond with the community, emphasizing her role in nurturing collective expression and unity.

Transition to the afternoon, where Luna seeks solitude in a serene natural setting, like a secluded beach or forest. Now the dialogue is internal.

Here, she delves into a personal artistic endeavor or meditation, reflecting her need for inner peace and self-reflection. Describe her surroundings, her emotions, and the introspective journey she undertakes, showing how this solitude contrasts with yet complements her earlier activities.

This chapter should delve into how these experiences on a day in late summer or early autumn mirror the transformative and reflective themes of the season, shedding light on Luna’s character and her influence on Anky's future. The narrative should seamlessly weave these elements into a cohesive story that not only portrays Luna’s day but also sets the stage for understanding the environment and values that will shape Anky's life.

</instructions>

<style>

Narrate in a style that allows the reader to infer Luna’s personality and values through her actions and interactions (show, don't tell). Utilize a blend of sentence structures to create a rhythmic and engaging flow. Dialogue should be minimal, yet impactful, revealing character nuances and genuine human interaction.

The narrative should be rich with descriptive imagery and strong verbs to vividly portray settings and emotions. Character voice for Luna should be distinctive, reflecting her artistic, nurturing, and contemplative nature. Introduce Luna's character and her day’s journey in a way that naturally unfolds her story, setting the foundation for her influence on Anky's life.

</style>

<setting>

The chapter unfolds over the course of a day during late summer or early autumn, showcasing the balance between communal engagement and personal reflection in Luna’s life. The morning is set in a vibrant community space where Luna leads an art project, infused with the warmth of the season and the collective spirit of the locals. The afternoon transitions to a tranquil natural setting, where Luna engages in personal artistic creation or meditation, surrounded by the changing season’s quiet beauty. This contrast highlights Luna’s multifaceted character and her journey through the day, mirroring the seasonal shift and its reflection in her life and future impact on Anky.

</setting>
chapter:
Luna arrived at the community center as the first rays of morning light filtered through the windows, igniting the vibrant murals adorning the walls. A dozen neighborhood children flocked around her, chattering excitedly as she unpacked boxes of art supplies onto long tables. She smiled warmly, ruffling a little girl's hair. 

"Who's ready to make some magic?" Luna asked, met by a chorus of cheers.

The kids gathered around as Luna displayed examples of mandalas, explaining their symbolic meaning in different cultures. She spoke enthusiastically about self-expression, imagination, and finding beauty in imperfection. A little boy raised his hand.

"Miss Luna, can we make our own mandalas about stuff we love?" 

"Of course! That's the whole idea," she said. "Now let's begin..."

Luna wandered around the room, admiring the kids' creations taking shape. Each mandala reflected their unique interests and personalities - flowers, superheroes, animals, favorite foods. She paused to help a shy girl blend her watercolors, praising the ocean scene emerging on the paper. 

Two boys argued over an art supply. "Ah ah, we create together here," Luna gently reminded them. Their frowns softened as she redirected their energy into adding to each other's mandalas. Laughter soon filled the room again.

As the morning sun climbed higher, Luna stepped back, overcome with pride at the joyful chaos. This was why she coordinated community art programs - to kindle creativity, connection, and empowerment. Watching the children share their visions, she saw the seeds of a more vibrant, inclusive world.

"Five minutes left, little artists!" Luna called out. The kids scrambled to add finishing touches, signing their names with flourish. She moved among them, complimenting unique details and techniques. 

Too soon, parents arrived to pick up their beaming children, mandalas held high. "Thank you, Miss Luna!" they chorused before scampering away, already chattering about their next creation. 

Luna smiled tiredly as she cleaned up scattered supplies. She lived for these communal moments of unleashed creativity, knowing that art could unite and empower communities. Witnessing the children translate imagination into expression filled her spirit.

The beach was deserted, save for Luna's solitary figure strolling by the water's edge. She relished these quiet moments alone after the morning's lively chaos. The rhythm of the waves calmed her active mind as she ambled past weathered driftwood, sea glass glinting in the sand. 

Finding a secluded cove, Luna settled cross-legged on a blanket, gazing out at the vast ocean. She inhaled deeply, breathing in the mingling scents of salt, earth, and pine. A light breeze caressed her skin as she closed her eyes, focusing inward. 

Slowing her breathing, Luna began mentally tracing an invisible mandala - a symbol of harmony, balance, and spiritual awakening. Each line and curve centered her further, opening a sacred inner space. Releasing thought, she touched a deeper wisdom, where her essence connected to the elements - water, wind, earth. 

Luna opened her eyes, picking up a seashell. Turning it slowly, she contemplated how life's beauty emerges gradually through quiet growth. She thought of the children from that morning, like seedlings beginning to unfurl. Her role was to nurture their creativity so it could bloom in myriad directions.

The fading light drew Luna's gaze upward, where the first faint stars appeared in the dusky sky. She inhaled the day's last warmth, gathering herself before the chill of evening set in. 

Tomorrow would bring new seeds to nurture, more creativity to cultivate in her little corner of the world. But tonight, Luna would paint by candlelight - translating the day's inspiration into art, and waiting for the next sunrise.
summaryOfChapter:
In Chapter 2, Luna's connection with her community and her deep-seated passion for art and nurturing creativity come to the fore. Her day begins at a community center, bathed in the morning light, where she leads a group of enthusiastic children in creating mandalas, teaching them about self-expression and the beauty of individuality. Her interactions with the children are tender and encouraging, showcasing her role as not just an artist but a mentor, fostering a sense of community and collective creativity.

As the workshop progresses, Luna's ability to manage and inspire the group shines through, turning potential conflicts into collaborative efforts and celebrating the unique creations of each child. This experience is deeply fulfilling for her, reaffirming her belief in the transformative power of art to bring people together and cultivate a sense of belonging and mutual respect.

After the bustling activity of the workshop, Luna seeks solace in the natural world, walking along the beach to reflect and find balance. In these moments of solitude, she contemplates the parallels between her art and the natural processes around her, seeing in the ebb and flow of the tide and the growth of the children she teaches a mirror of her own creative journey. This introspection leads her to a deeper understanding of her role as both an artist and a guide, nurturing the seeds of creativity and watching them grow into something beautiful and enduring.

The chapter closes with Luna preparing for another day of artistic and personal exploration, symbolizing the continuous cycle of inspiration, creation, and reflection in her life. Her story arc in this chapter beautifully encapsulates the themes of artistic passion, mentorship, and the search for personal and communal harmony, setting the stage for further developments in her journey.

This prompt brings an interesting internal dilemma of mine to the surface. The prompt implies that we are "conceived" of by our parents, but the word 'conceive' also has a cognitive component.

9 months before I was born, 21 January of 1992. It was a hot summer day. My parents where probably with other friends at a gathering or simply enjoying the summer holidays somewhere in the world. I love the weather and freedom from this month. I associate southern hemisphere summer with being outside, the beach, lots of activities, friends gathered together. This energy, at the same time can bring down effects if not handled properly. For example, I remember as negative feelings of this season, the social anxiety of missing out or not being ready with a plan to enjoy. Always trying to be part of something and trying to be where the sun shines at its brightest (in a metaphorical way), this means looking for the hype or the cool things. Nevertheless, Summer has always given me nice stories to share, lots of growth and being outside of the comfort zone. I love enjoying the sun, beach, waves. In this season Ive met many new friends, got into problems which then became stories to share and the connection with water was always present.

One True Three Four    I don't know which month it was but it is a question for cicadas to answer. all i know is that birches grew not far. Everything was blooming. whether in the nature or people's minds. if the month was january, then it was cold, but even though there was not enough good food, people found depth in their experience. sometimes i wish that time continued into the present, but maybe it exists in other people's days, not as much in my own. i wish there was more to say about the birches, but all they were doing was standing and listening to the wind howl quietly but coldly, freezingly. snow sometimes turned to a crispy ice on its top and reflected the brightest sun ever known to crows in this side of town. the houses were mostly heated with coal, and one could smell that smoke eerywhere through the city. i wonder if the streetcar track was there or if it was built later. probably it was, just laying there, dividing the city in square and triangle parts. i love winter. i love going into the banya and then running out into the snow, sometimes, i just wish i was there fully present, but i guess i needed to learn that lesson. hindsight is not a trait common to many. or maybe it is but everyone's hiding it, even from themselves. we kinda know what's going to happen. who are we? who am i
i will find out

Calculating nine months before my birth it would be the month of May. A month that personally marks the beginning of the winter season, a stage of the year that is marked by a decrease in natural light, the beginning of rain and bad weather. Personally, it is the month that begins the season of the year that I like the least. A necessary period during the year that generates instances of contemplation, tranquility and greater rest but that affects me emotionally due to the lack of light and hours to enjoy my days.
Thinking more deeply, it is a month that is the opposite of my favorite months, more linked to the date on which I was born. I was shovelling the snow outside after a huge snow- and school had been called off. During this time I felt particularly lonely. Not alone, there were always people around. I was always introspective, but these intense childhood experiences with so much trauma made me go inward even more. I wanted connection, to be seen, and to be loved. I think it happened during the spring. Beyond the stereotyped romanticism of spring, there exists within me a strange, and very transcendental fixation with the buds of trees that seem dead in winter. There is something extraordinary about that event. The most fragile part of the shoot is capable of breaking the bark of the tree, and with infinite tenderness, super special colors appear in the light of day.
Those colors also reflect something in my life. They are the colors I am using right now in my clothes.
It is spectacular to understand that a scenario existed before you even had eyes formed in your skull, you were inhabiting the earth, who knows in how many forms before incarnating in a dense physical body.
These scenarios taught us other essential aspects of life.
Spring must have helped romanticize my parents' union.
And that feeling, if some formality was transmitted.
I also remember the greening of the Andes, and their miniature flowers, covering a meadow on the southern slope.

In my case, nine months before my birth the month of May falls. For me, a month that marks the beginning of the period of the year that I like the least. It is a month that I associate with the change in light, the arrival of the cold and, above all, the rain. Thinking about this month I mainly have no positive memories associated with it, it is a month that for me personally marks the beginning of winter in the place I currently live. May is a month of heavy rain and storms, it marks the beginning of dark and cold months, in which I will have little light in my days during a winter season. Thinking about it from the depths of my being, it is probably the month that begins the period of the year that I like the least but that on the other hand is very necessary. A period of introspection, of tranquility, of going to bed early and resting, a necessary period of the year

My mom was around 30 years old when I was born. She had a good support network form what i know. Her mom and two sisters were around to help out. They lived in a town about 45 min drive away. So not too much of an inconvience, all things considered. My dads family lived in another town about 2 hours away. There was not much support needed from either side. My immediate family has always been independent. My dad worked a lot when I was younger, starting before I was born. He did help to provide finincial support, housing, safety, all the provider things expected. My mom has told the story of getting to the hospital when I was born. Aprearantly my dad was working so my mom ended up having to drive herself to the hospital, while in labor. It all worked out in the end as there were no complications with the birth. She says my dad just had to show up and cut the cord, while she did all the work. That is a main trait I admire about my mom. Her fortitude and independance was well beyond her time. I think she will be a great example for my niece to follow

My mom moved to the US when she was 21 years old after my father had won the green card lottery in poland through a special program for those trying to escape communism in a post soviet era poland. When she arrived, she had very little material possesions, could hardly speak the language, and was largely disappointed that my father had swindled her into living situations that were not ideal. In poland, she came from well off family but after world war II the situation in poland was up in the air and many people were fleeing the country. She arrived in the US already pregnant with my brother and far away from anyone in her family.
